item.title: Harvard University Campus Guided Walking Tour
item.description: For anyone thinking of attending Harvard, or for those who simply want a glimpse of college life at the famous university, this tour is a must. Get an exclusive account from current Harvard students, who provide key insights into the life and times at Cambridge with a theatrical, humorous flair. Check out the old buildings at Harvard Yard and Harvard Square and learn about the school’s storied past. Illustrated map of Harvard Square included. Choose from several departure times throughout the day.

image.alt: Harvard University Campus Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Public MIT Campus Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Walk the quads of the campus that inspired astronauts, Nobel Peace Prize winners, and famed innovators in just about every discipline on a student-led tour of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Get an inside look on what it’s like to attend the prestigious university and hear real stories about what makes MIT special.

image.alt: Public MIT Campus Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Illustrious Schools: Group Tour of MIT And Harvard
item.description:
The tour starts on the MIT campus, where you will follow your guide to learn about the school's history, famous pranks, inventions, and much more! Your tour guide will show you buildings designed by world-famous architects, dormitories home to hilarious MIT "hacks", and stunning views of Boston from across the river!
After MIT, your tour guide will take you to Harvard using the subway system. Your subway fare is included in the cost of the tour.
Learn the history Harvard University, the oldest college in the country. See the "Statue of the Three Lies", deceiving visitors for almost 150 years. Learn about Harvard's academic legacy, as well as some rather whimsical traditions practiced by the students! See the house where George Washington stayed during his visit to Boston during the American Revolution and Harvard's part in the war. The tour will show you the academic, residential, and hidden parts of one of the world's most prestigious universities!

image.alt: Illustrious Schools: Group Tour of MIT And Harvard

item.title: Public Innovation Trail Tour in Cambridge
item.description: Proof that history is not just for the past! From anti-aging technology to gene-editing, the newest discoveries coming out of Cambridge are building on the historical inventions of things as diverse as woven fire hoses and the microwave oven. Guides from TripAdvisor's #1 attraction in Cambridge will do their best to blow your mind as we invite you to explore the history-makers working in Kendall Square right now. See which of today's cutting-edge discoveries will be in the history books of the future.

image.alt: Public Innovation Trail Tour in Cambridge

item.title: Harvard Square Chocolate Tour
item.description: Combine a historical Cambridge tour with an indulgent chocolate tasting on this engaging walking tour. Pick between afternoon and evening departure times, and meet your guide in the center of Cambridge; with a maximum of 15 attendees, this tour guarantees a personal way to explore. See historical Harvard Square and learn about Harvard University’s history. You’ll also enjoy locally made ice cream, will sip chocolate tea, will browse a traditional candy shop, and much more.

image.alt: Harvard Square Chocolate Tour

item.title: Harvard Square Cambridge Food & Walking Tour
item.description:
Calling all foodies! We'd love to take you on a Food Tour neighborhood adventure in Harvard Square!
Join us for a delicious culinary adventure through historical Harvard Square. You'll hear interesting stories about the Square, learn fun facts about the places we visit, and sample the best and most interesting food around -- and a lot of it. Located right outside of Boston in Cambridge on the Red Line MBTA Train Stop, Harvard Square is home to Harvard University and also has a flourishing food scene with some of the best and most unique food in the city.
Each tour is 2 hours and includes 5 stops with plenty of food and less than a mile of walking. We can't wait to take you on a unique, foodie adventure! While we can accommodate gluten or dairy-free options on our other tours, on this tour there are two stops where gluten or dairy-free substitutions are not available unfortunately.

image.alt: Harvard Square Cambridge Food & Walking Tour

item.title: Union Square, Somerville Neighborhood Food Tour
item.description: Taste your way through Union Square, Somerville with this neighborhood food tour. Discover the area that saw the creation of marshmallow fluff and the raising of the first American flag. Walk the streets and stop for delicious tastings at five or six restaurants. Sample a range of local favorites and ethnic delicacies. This tour is suitable for all ages, with alcohol available to guests 21 and over.

image.alt: Union Square, Somerville Neighborhood Food Tour

item.title: The Mysterious Porcelain Club Quest Experience in Harvard Yard
item.description: Discover the highlights of Cambridge’s Harvard Yard—without having to spend hours doing research—thanks to this fun and interactive self-guided exploration game. Smartphone access via an app means there’s no need to waste time picking up equipment, so you can play whenever suits your schedule. Places that feature on the route include Widener Library, Johnston Gate, Holden Chapel, and the Harvard Lampoon Building.

image.alt: The Mysterious Porcelain Club Quest Experience in Harvard Yard

item.title: Central Square Cambridge Food and Mural Arts Guided Walking Tour
item.description:
Have fun and unleash your inner art critic while exploring Central Square, Cambridge with us.
Home to a vibrant public art scene, including iconic Graffiti Alley, a sanctioned graffiti walkway that changes daily, and a variety of impressive large scale murals commissioned by the city from award-winning local talent. Uncover the artists and meaning behind these dynamic murals and enjoy delicious, diverse eats from local independent restaurants including gyoza, specialty granola, buddha bowl, oysters, and unique donuts. Guests are invited to try a mocktail or cocktail on this tour, and it is appropriate for all ages. If you’re lucky, you’ll even get a special tour of a hidden passageway.
This fun and informative walk will change the way you think about Cambridge. Our friendly and local guides will take guests along Massachusetts Avenue to uncover the evolution of the area and the ever-increasing importance of self expression. Please bring proof of COVID vaccination.

image.alt: Central Square Cambridge Food and Mural Arts Guided Walking Tour

item.title: LEGO® Discovery Center Boston Admission Ticket
item.description: Start your adventure by creating your own LEGO Minifigure companion who can join you throughout your journey in the different areas of the attraction. You'll be able to customize your Minifigure with a torso, a head, legs, and a hat and take them home with you after your visit!

image.alt: LEGO® Discovery Center Boston Admission Ticket

item.title: Boston City Private Tour
item.description:
Why Choose Boston Pro's Private Historic Tour?
Luxury Experience: Our luxury SUV ensures a comfortable and stylish exploration of Boston's best attractions, including a scenic drive along the picturesque Waterfront.
Customized Itinerary: Enjoy the flexibility to customize your tour. Whether it's spending more time at Harvard, MIT, or lingering in the charming streets of Beacon Hill, the itinerary is tailored to your preferences.
Photo Opportunities: Our tour is designed for avid photographers. From the iconic Acorn Street to the scenic views along the Waterfront, every moment is a photo opportunity that captures the essence of your Boston experience.

image.alt: Boston City Private Tour

item.title: Unique Scavenger Hunt in Cambridge by Zombie Scavengers
item.description: Zombie Scavengers takes you on an adventure in Cambridge to survive the zombie apocalypse! Use our app and some strategy to find a list of items needed to survive, in any order you'd prefer, around the city. Find the survival items to get points and do fun zombie themed challenges for points as well. Contrive a plan to get your survival team the most points in order to survive the apocalypse! Your remote host will follow along virtually and provide support if you need it. Can you survive the apocalypse in Cambridge?

image.alt: Unique Scavenger Hunt in Cambridge by Zombie Scavengers

item.title: Boston's Original Dumpling Party // Cambridge
item.description:
Get all the tips and tricks you need to learn to make mouthwatering dumplings while hearing stories about Chinese and Taiwanese cultural food traditions.
Why we love this experience • Learn how to roll, stuff, and fold 4-5 styles of dumplings, and sample Taiwanese street food bites • Guest can BYOB and tea bar included • Public classes are held at the historical Windsor Inn, which is the oldest free-standing residence in the central square • Team building, birthday/bachelorette, couples night • Limited free parking on site

image.alt: Boston's Original Dumpling Party // Cambridge

item.title: East Coast USA: Self-Guided Driving & Walking Tour Bundle
item.description: Explore some of the best spots for fall foliage on the East Coast, including Acadia, Shenandoah, and Great Smoky Mountains national parks, Kancamagus Highway, Blue Ridge Parkway, Bar Harbor, Newport, Salem, and the Freedom Trail, with this self-guided driving tour. Enjoy the flexibility to travel at your own pace, with hands-free functionality, turn-by-turn directions, and offline access. Includes full itineraries, travel tips, audio guide, and text.

image.alt: East Coast USA: Self-Guided Driving & Walking Tour Bundle

item.title: Self-Guided Scavenger Hunt: Historic Harvard Hunt
item.description:
Let’s Roam is the #1 app-led adventure hunt company. Explore the best landmarks and hidden gems, answering trivia questions and tackling challenges along the way. Team up with your friends or go head-to-head as you uncover fascinating facts and create unforgettable memories.
Let’s Roam Adventure Hunts are perfect for any occasion—whether it's an everyday outing, a bachelorette bash, a birthday celebration, or a corporate team-building extravaganza! Each player gets to choose an interactive role, with unique challenges for everyone. Ready for an adventure? Let's Roam!

image.alt: Self-Guided Scavenger Hunt: Historic Harvard Hunt

item.title: Harvard University Scavenger Hunt and Escape Game
item.description:
There's nothing quite like The Great Game. It's like a scavenger hunt mixed with an escape room. Built around the coolest places in the world (like Harvard University), it is a completely unique way to explore an incredible area.
Over 200,000 players have played around the world and across all platforms we have a 9.2/10 player satisfaction score.
It is completely self guided, so you can go at your own pace. There are built in hints, so you will never get stuck in the adventure. As you walk from location to location, the app will teach you more about various parts of the Harvard University and why they are so special.
In the Harvard Heist, the Harvard Art Museums have been robbed and it is up to your team of detectives to recover the stolen painting.

image.alt: Harvard University Scavenger Hunt and Escape Game

item.title: Harvard's Haunts Solo Smart Phone Guided App Ghost Walking Tour
item.description:
Welcome to Harvard’s Famous Haunts Walking Tour, where we journey through the historic and eerie corners of the oldest university in America.
Go at your own pace, anytime. This tour is all location aware and guided by our walking tour app. It's hands free. Put the phone in your pocket and it plays as you walk. the narration is spooky an infused with spooky music to fit the stories.
Founded in 1636, Harvard is steeped in centuries of history, intellectual achievement, and tradition—but with that comes ghostly legends and supernatural tales that have lingered for generations.
As we walk through Harvard Yard and the surrounding area, we’ll uncover stories of haunted churches, library, gates, dormitories and buildings.

image.alt: Harvard's Haunts Solo Smart Phone Guided App Ghost Walking Tour

item.title: Cambridge LGBTQ+ History Walking Tour
item.description:
Join us on our Cambridge LGBTQ+ Visionaries Walking Tour! On this tour around Cambridge, we will learn about the many ‘firsts’ in LGBTQ+ organizing and the LGBTQ+ rights movement by visiting historic sites and exploring the stories of activists that paved the way before us.
Along this tour, you’ll see where the first same-sex marriages in the country took place, learn about a Black feminist organizing collective, visit the location where the earliest women and queer studies courses occurred, and hear about advocacy for LGBTQ+ students in public schools. Sites include Cambridge City Hall, the Cambridge Public Library, Cambridge Rindge & Latin School, Harvard Square, and more.

image.alt: Cambridge LGBTQ+ History Walking Tour

item.title: Creative Cambridge Scavenger Hunt
item.description:
Our very unique, immersive adventures are the only ones of their kind. We, unlike other companies, provide your very own remote, interactive, live host to assist and encourage you along through your phone. We are an Austin, TX-based global custom event design company offering scavenger hunts and other events in 300+ cities in North America and beyond. Our specially hand-crafted adventures are equal parts tour, creative challenge, detective hunt, and social experiment!
Guests get to discover in an alternate reality our favorite hidden gems off the beaten trail and creatively interpret fun art, history, and culture clues - for points! They get to enjoy fame and glory while appearing on our website’s international leaderboard, no matter what their score. They get to essentially race other teams in other cities, even if they don’t have competitors who have signed up in their city that day. Get ready to discover unusual oddities, laugh out loud, and make the experience your own!

image.alt: Creative Cambridge Scavenger Hunt

item.title: Homecooked Vegan Meal in Cambridge, MA
item.description:
This is a unique opportunity to visit the home of a local and explore traditional culture and cuisine. Join Marla and Max in their modern home to share a vegan meal. You will also meet Becca Sue (a rescue from Natchez, Mississippi) their beautiful dog who loves humans! Marla is a passionate home cook who specializes in vegan world cuisine. She loves cooking plant based meals and is so happy to share it with travelers. Marla loves to cook with ingredients that are fresh and in season.
So your menu will vary depending on the season, but a few dishes that you can expect to try are pesto pizza (typical toppings include spinach, potatoes and mushrooms), salad or homemade cornbread, mushroom stroganoff and chili sin carne or glazed tofu. End your meal with some homemade ice cream, berries and dark chocolate. If you're looking for a wholesome vegan meal in Boston, Marla's homemade vegan meal will not disappoint!

image.alt: Homecooked Vegan Meal in Cambridge, MA
